findings.rationale: The Employer's perpetual and exclusive license to all work product may limit the Employee's ability to leverage their own creations in future employment.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider grants Employer a perpetual, exclusive license to use all work product created during employment for Employer's business purposes.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations that extend for three years post-termination may hinder the Employee's future employment opportunities.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations survive termination and continue for 3 years.

findings.rationale: The one-year non-compete clause could severely restrict the Employee's ability to find new employment in their field after leaving the company.
findings.evidence_quote: Employee may not compete within the same industry for 1 year after termination.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual compensation may expose the Employee to significant financial risk in case of negligence.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual compensation.

findings.rationale: The ability for either party to terminate the agreement for convenience with only 30 days notice may lead to job insecurity for the Employee.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.
